item.title: Urgent – Dangerous Dip Beside Drop-Down Curb Causing Vehicle Damage, 14th October
item.description:
I am writing to follow up on an issue I reported last year regarding a large dip beside the drop-down curb outside my property. Unfortunately, I have not received any update or seen any repair work carried out, and the problem has worsened significantly since my initial report. The section of road next to the drop-down curb has crumbled away, leaving a deep dip that has been getting progressively larger. This has now become both a safety hazard and a source of ongoing vehicle damage. Over the past year, I have had to replace the tyre on the front wheel I use to turn into the drive twice, and my car recently failed its MOT due to excessive tyre wear likely caused by repeatedly driving over this damaged section. In addition to the financial cost, the situation is becoming dangerous. When I attempt to drive onto my property, my small car often becomes stuck in the dip, forcing me to rev the engine harder to get out—something that is particularly risky given the narrow road and parked cars nearby. I would be grateful if this matter could be reviewed as soon as possible, and if necessary, for an inspection and repair to be scheduled urgently to make this part of the road safe for access again.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 22, Brownspring Drive, New Eltham, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Illegal Advertising, 14th October
item.description:

item.title: Large pot hole with accute edges a danger to Cars and liable to burst a tyre., 14th October
item.description:
The pot hole has been here for a few months and is growing now. Has sharp edges and would burst a tyre if driven over, even at just a slow speed. The position is right in the driver side tyres of pass vehicles so in a dangerous location.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Rectory Lane, North Cray, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Bidborough House, 14th October
item.description:
The top half of the street light is missing - it is covered by yellow tape. There are many blind and low vision people who work and study in this area who need the street light back.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 38-50, Bidborough Street, St Pancras, London
